GraphicsLab

Class Colour

  • java.lang.Object
    • GraphicsLab.Colour

  • public class Colour
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates the concept of a colour consisting of red, green and blue components
    Author:
    Anthony Jones and Dan Cornford

    • Field Summary

      static Colour BLACK

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Colour(float red, float green, float blue)
      Constructs a Colour object from its RGB components with a float in the range 0-1.
      Colour(int red, int green, int blue)
      Constructs a Colour object from its RGB components as integers

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void submit()
      Submits this Colour to OpenGL using an immediate mode call

    • Constructor Detail

      • Colour

        public Colour(float red,
              float green,
              float blue)
        Constructs a Colour object from its RGB components with a float in the range 0-1.
        Parameters:
        red - The Colour's red component
        green - The Colour's green component
        blue - The Colour's blue component

      • Colour

        public Colour(int red,
              int green,
              int blue)
        Constructs a Colour object from its RGB components as integers
        Parameters:
        red - The Colour's red component (int 0-255)
        green - The Colour's green component (int 0-255)
        blue - The Colour's blue component (int 0-255)
